# Arpeggio: Dominant 7#5 in G (Shape: A)

## Description
The Dominant 7#5 arpeggio is a four-note arpeggio consisting of the root, major third, augmented fifth, and minor seventh of a dominant 7#5 chord. In the key of G, the notes would be G (Root), B (Major Third), D# (Augmented Fifth), and F (Minor Seventh). This arpeggio has a unique and colorful sound due to the augmented fifth interval.

## Notes and Intervals
- G (Root)
- B (Major Third)
- D# (Augmented Fifth)
- F (Minor Seventh)
  
## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Dominant 7#5 arpeggio is often used in jazz, fusion, and experimental music genres. Its augmented fifth adds tension and dissonance to the sound, creating a sense of excitement and unpredictability in harmonic progressions. It is commonly used as a passing chord or for coloristic effect in solos and improvisations.
